definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: In the dark pines the wind disentangles itself.
sentences.chinese: 在松樹的陰影下，風放開自己。

sentences.english: Seeds are open - minded, drink a heaven-sent "holy water."
sentences.chinese: 種子們放開胸懷，暢飲着天賜的“聖水”。

sentences.english: Let go hand in a noisy streets, find the pupil picture www. anhuiqq. cn.
sentences.chinese: 放開手在喧鬧的大街，找不到瞳孔中的畫面。

sentences.english: Release the Foot Switch when the Calibration Indicator reaches its set position.
sentences.chinese: 當刻度指示器指向規定的位置，放開腳踏板。

sentences.english: At this, he instantly let me go, and I ran for my life.
sentences.chinese: 聽到這話，他立刻放開了我，我於是拼命逃跑。

sentences.english: Be open to growing in that direction. You owe it to yourself.
sentences.chinese: 請放開向夢想的方向成長吧，這歸功於你自己。

sentences.english: Just let go and let yourself be in the moment.
sentences.chinese: 只是放開並讓自己處在當下時刻。

sentences.english: Until the lane Mo jeans aloud of ask for forgiveness, he just release her.
sentences.chinese: 直到弄墨氣喘吁吁的討饒，他才放開她。

sentences.english: They threw their hands in the air.
sentences.chinese: 他們把手放開伸在空中。

sentences.english: Now the hall-boy pounded on the door and he released his hold upon her regretfully.
sentences.chinese: 這時旅館的茶房把門敲得砰砰響，他遺憾地放開了她。

sentences.english: Ironically, letting go of what you want is the only way to get it.
sentences.chinese: 諷刺的是，放開你想要的是得到它的唯一方法。

sentences.english: Singest of summer in full-throated ease.
If this book is allowed to be published the floodgates will open.
sentences.chinese: 如果這本書被允許出版，水閘將被放開。

sentences.english: I give you, love, is the final release.
sentences.chinese: 我給你，最後的疼愛，是手放開。

sentences.english: Drag along an ice hockey with the mouse, the or so ambulation releases again a mouse.
sentences.chinese: 用鼠標拖住冰球，左右移動再放開鼠標。

sentences.english: Finally the love is a hand release, later, you are in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 最後的疼愛是手放開，以後，你在我心裏。

definition: to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
(in the) past/former/previous/to go over/to pass by
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
